ygData.subject: Re: Back to the Ark
ygData.msgSnippet: With his determination, Tucson reaches the ark in vehicle form as he transmits an access code to get into the Ark without harming himself or Lord Elder.  He

With his determination, Tucson reaches the ark in vehicle form as he transm=
its an access code to get into the Ark without harming himself or Lord Elde=
r.  He comes to a screeching halt inside, gently opening his front door, an=
d lowering his left side to gently set Lord Elder out of his cab on his fee=
t, and then rolls back to transform into robot mode.

"Sorry to push you ou=
t like that in such a hurry Lord Elder, I promise I will give you fair warn=
ing the next time I do that."

He then finds his old friend Kup.  He never =
thought he'd see his old friend again, after being stuck in the torture cha=
mber in the dark fortress.  But after being beaten severely, dented and dam=
aged, he now found himself home among his comrades.  Even if it was just Ku=
p and Elita, he felt like he was finally home.

" It's good to be back Kup,=
 I missed you both immensely.  Now, before I forget, you asked me of news o=
f Rodimus and Nightlight.  Unfortunately, the Predacons have placed a shell=
 program over Rodimus which has corrupted his physical and mental state.  I=
 fear the same fate awaits Nightlight.  But I promise both of you, I will N=
OT give up on them.  But, in order for me to rescue them, we'll need more h=
elp and we also have to deal with the threat outside.  That won't be easy. =
  We have many issues happening all around us and very few of us to deal wi=
th them.  But I feel that we can't do everything unless we recover Rodimus =
and Nightlight, and bring them back home where they belong."

He sighs.

" =
From what I remember, there are also Decepticons lying on the floor among o=
ur comrades.  Decepticons who have been cast asside like junk all for power=
 and greed.  If we're going to revive the Autobots we - will also revive th=
e Decepticons.  I know it's hard to do, seeing their track record but, some=
times your greatest enemy can turn out to be your friend.  We'll need all t=
he help we can get.  Kup, thank you for getting my weapon ready.  I appreci=
ate it deeply.  But now, I - need to pay a visit to Optimus Prime."

Tucson=
 feels his way around in the Ark, remembering where things were before his =
loss of sight, and even afterwards.  He comes to where Optimus Prime lays d=
orment and where many Autobots and Decepticons lie in a state of stasis as =
well.  He feels where he believes is where Optimus Prime is not too far fro=
m him, and kneels down before his past leader.  

" You always knew how to =
handle tough situations.  No matter the level of difficulty you always led =
the Autobots into victory.  I miss your guidence, and wisdom and wish you w=
ere here now to lend me a hand, because Primus knows I could use it.  Rodim=
us has been taken wrongfully from us, by Hydras and Cyclonus.  I don't know=
 exactly how it happened, and why it happened.  Why would a warrior as stro=
ng as Rodimus ever give into such an evil force?  After he became our leade=
r, I thought the world of him as I did of you.  I will never lose sight of =
his wisdom but why do I feel as if I've been betrayed?  Optimus, I've also =
been asked how I'm related to you. I can't answer that question because I d=
idn't know the answer.  And I still don't know the answer."

He raises his =
head as if to listen for any signs of life.

" I do promise you something O=
ptimus Prime, even through thoughts of betrayal, I will never turn a blind =
eye on my Autobot comrade, even though, anger almost made me think otherwis=
e.  I have to curb my temper, I'm aware of that.  Unless I know the story f=
rom Rodimus's point of view I will not judge him as you have taught me.  In=
nocent until proven guilty.  Well, that's about it Optimus, I haven't much =
more to tell you or to ask of you.  May you rest peacefully in the arms of =
Primus himself." 

He gets back up onto his feet, and salutes Optimus Prime=
.

> Kup:
> 
> 
> "=
Count with that!! " Said Kup whose ran towards Tucson's quarters and Set a =
good amount of Arrows in Tucson's crossbow, then he opened his con link and=
 said "your weapon is ready... Lord Elder what's the safest place of the Ar=
k? if A battle starts here i want to place Elita in the safest point."

>   
> Tucson kne=
w how to deal with followers. If they were still in the area, a good sonic =
blast from his sonar system would surely mess up their telemetry and do a n=
umber on their own gyroscopic systems. He comes to a short halt, tired of b=
eing stalked, he kicks up dust around short pivoting tires with a loud scre=
ech, and configures his sonar attack to be harmless to Autobt and Maximal k=
ind but NOT harmless to Predacons or Decepticons! 
> 
> " That's it, I am n=
ot going to play by the rules ANY MORE! THEY WANT TROUBLE THEY GOT IT!"
> 
=
> He blasts the sonar attack at full pitch.
> 
> " Kup, if you pick up a so=
nar disturbance, don't worry, it's me. It may effect your computer systems =
and I do appologize for that. But whatever or whoever is out there isn't ab=
out to get away that easy!" 
> 
> He puts himself into drive and continues =
his drive toward the Ark, blasting the attack continuously.
> 
> "They thin=
k I'm a pushover on wheels, they'll think twice after this, I assure you Lo=
rd Elder... They'll think twice."
> 
> He tries really hard to hold back a =
short temper. Tucson knew when to play games and when it was time to get se=
rious. This was the time to get serious.
> 
> "Oh yeah, Kup, in my quarters=
 you'll find a cross bow in my weapon chamber. Please, have that ready for =
me when I get back and make sure to put a good amount of plasma arrows in t=
he energizer for me. You'll find all of that near an old sun dial I was wor=
king on before I left the Ark ages ago."
> 
> He turns his attentions back =
to Lord Elder.
> 
> " Before all this happened to me, my spare time was spe=
nt restorring old artifacts and weapons. I'm hoping to go back to doing som=
e resteration, it's the only thing that quells my temper which I do admit, =
gets rather short in times like these. Remind me to show you what I've done=
 when we get back to the Ark. I have a small work area in my quarters where=
 I've managed to restore a few small artifacts... Well including one fairly=
 large sun dial.. But most of all, I've saved and restorred ancient Autobot=
 weaponry which may still prove useful to us now. I have a feeling we might=
 just need it."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <superc=
yclonus@> wrote:
> >
> > The trip back is mildly uneventful. The day moved =
forward as the sun
> > slid from its mid point position to a one significan=
tly lower in the
> > skies. Occasionally in the distance a large dinosaur c=
ould be seen,
> > from a predator who glanced in the direction of Lord Elde=
r and Tuscon,
> > but who realized quickly that this metal machine was defi=
nitely not
> > prey; to a sauropod, who's small head on a long neck turned =
to look
> > at the vehicle passed by, and even the smaller variety of creat=
ures,
> > from scavengers to predator, ones who typically scattered as the
=
> > vehicle that was Tuscon bounced and yet moved easily across the broken
=
> > terrain.
> > 
> > Up ahead the trees, which had been near constant comp=
anions during
> > most of their trip began to break away as they came into =
more open
> > country. Up ahead the beginnings of a mountain range could be=
 seen.
> > Above them a flock of what could almost look like birds flew, al=
though
> > instead of possessing feathers, they had large leathery and larg=
er
> > bodies.
> > 
> > "We're almost back" Lord Elder said. He had been si=
lent through most
> > of the trip, his face wearing a thoughtful look. "The=
re, that mountain
> > over there, at the base of it."
> > 
> > "I'll activa=
te the door in the shield for us." Elder said as he was
> > about to open a=
 communication signal to the Ark. However Elder paused
> > and look around,=
 as if looking for something. "Something's wrong here
> > . . . " he said a=
s he continued to look.
> > 
> > Above them the prehistoric avians turned a=
lmost as one, their calls
> > almost defiant as they moved swiftly in the d=
irection that Tuscon and
> > Elder had come from. "It's like we're being wa=
tched."
> > 
> > (TAG)
> > 
> > Preston
> > (Lord Elder)
